title: Introduction to `MDPIexploreR`
text: MDPIexploreR functions rely journal codes. usually journal titles (e.g. Plants), occasionally abbreviations (e.g., IJERPH). find code journal plan explore use MDPI_journals() function. function fetches data official MDPI journals page https://www.mdpi.com//journals generates table containing names journals along corresponding codes.
code: MDPI_journals()|>head(10) #>                             journal            code #> 1                         Acoustics       acoustics #> 2     Acta Microbiologica Hellenica             amh #> 3                         Actuators       actuators #> 4           Administrative Sciences          admsci #> 5                       Adolescents     adolescents #> 6  Advances in Respiratory Medicine             arm #> 7                       Aerobiology     aerobiology #> 8                         Aerospace       aerospace #> 9                       Agriculture     agriculture #> 10                  AgriEngineering agriengineering

title: Introduction to `MDPIexploreR`
text: MDPIexploreR makes easy obtain list articles published journal. example, get list articles published journal “MDPI Covid” just need : can use article_info() function obtain editorial information journals. example, let’s extract information sample ten articles journal Covid. Note articles journal , longer take retrieve information. progress bar display current status. large requests, recommend stable internet connection dividing results article_find() smaller vectors. general rule, retrieving information one article takes approximately 1.2 seconds—plan accordingly! Visualize output article_info() using plot_articles() function, comes three types graphs:   # Special issues guest editors Similar functions article() family, use journal code obtain information special issues gues editors. compile list journal special issues use special_issue_find() function. function allows obtain special issus journal, limit output year year threshold choose open closed articles. Lets find closed special issues journal Plants, year 2021 2023: explore role guest editors special issues, can use URLs guest_editor_info() function. example use function sample five articles: function outputs table several columns, including: number papers special issue (excluding editorial-type articles), number articles authored guest editor (flags), ratio articles flags (prop_flag), indicates fraction articles authored guest editors special issue. Additional columns include deadline special issue, date last article submission, much time, , submission exceeded deadline. rt_sum_vector2 column provides count guest editor, representing number papers authored special issue. Finally, aca_flag column highlights number papers academic editor also served guest editor.

title: Introduction to `MDPIexploreR`
text: Full disclosure: rcrossref package can work wonders estimating self-citation rates. selfcite_check() function package good job well, relies information provided MDPI references, sometimes truncates author lists using ‘et al.’ result, believe function serves good starting point, comprehensive analysis, additional tools like rcrossref may needed. selfcite_check won’t work paper directly available online (e.g., available pdf) Happy exploring!

title: Using plot_articles()
text: function plot_articles() uses data frame resulting using article_info() plot predefined graph types summarize different function plot_articles() uses data frame resulting article_info() create predefined graph types summarize various aspects data. addition output article_info(), plot_articles() requires: string specifying journal name labeling plot. type argument select desired graph type. Currently, five graph types available. , demonstrate options using Agriculture dataset obtained via article_info().

title: Using plot_articles()
text: type option generates dot graph, dot publication, year published.

title: Using plot_articles()
text: type option shows monthly changes turnaround times (times submission article acceptance)
code: plot_articles(agriculture,"Agriculture",type="tat") #> Scale for x is already present. #> Adding another scale for x, which will replace the existing scale.

title: Using plot_articles()
text: type option shows yearly evolution proportions special issues, sections, topics normal articles.

title: Using plot_articles()
text: type option shows yearly evolution types articles published (Editorials, reviews,etc).  function plot_articles() provides predefined graph types designed summarize key aspects data quickly effectively. However, users encouraged explore data frame produced article_info() create custom visualizations tailored specific needs. flexibility output makes easy integrate popular R visualization libraries ggplot2 plotly. develop unique insightful graphs benefit users, consider submitting code ideas contribute enhancing package.

what: Simple functions to explore MDPI corpus
title: Simple functions to explore MDPI corpus
text: Welcome wonders MDPIexploreR, R package created provide comprehensive tools scrape analyze data MDPI journals. allows users extract metrics submission--acceptance times, article types, whether articles part special issues. package can also visualize information plots. Additionally, MDPIexploreR offers tools explore patterns self-citations within articles provides insights guest-edited special issues.

what: This function retrieves the URLs for all published articles from a specified journal. Users can provide the journal's code 'see MDPI_journals.rda', and the function will return the URLs of all articles available within the journal. — article_find
title: This function retrieves the URLs for all published articles from a specified journal. Users can provide the journal's code 'see MDPI_journals.rda', and the function will return the URLs of all articles available within the journal. — article_find
text: function retrieves URLs published articles specified journal. Users can provide journal's code 'see MDPI_journals.rda', function return URLs articles available within journal.

title: This function retrieves the URLs for all published articles from a specified journal. Users can provide the journal's code 'see MDPI_journals.rda', and the function will return the URLs of all articles available within the journal. — article_find

what: This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info
title: This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info
text: function extracts key editorial information one paper URLs. Specifically, retrieves submission, revision, acceptance dates, well article type. function also calculates turnaround time (duration submission acceptance) identifies whether paper part special issue.

title: This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info

This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info
text: vector vector urls. sleep Number seconds scraping iterations. 2 sec. default sample_size number. many papers want explore main vector. Leave blank show_progress Logical. TRUE, progress bar displayed function execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info
text: data frame (class: data.frame) following columns: URL article information retrieved. article_type classification article (e.g., editorial, review). Received date article received publisher. Revised date article confirmed revised publisher. Accepted date article accepted publication. tat turnaround time, calculated number days received accepted dates. year year article accepted publication. issue_type Indicates whether article part special issue. open_peer_review Indictes article peer review publicly available

title: This function extracts key editorial information from one or more paper URLs. Specifically, it retrieves the submission, revision, and acceptance dates, as well as the article type. The function also calculates the turnaround time (the duration from submission to acceptance) and identifies whether the paper is part of a special issue. — article_info

text: Retrieves special issues specified journal URLs. Filters results issue status (open, closed, ) optional year range.

title: Retrieves all special issues of a specified journal with URLs. Filters results by issue status (open, closed, or all) and optional year range. — special_issue_find
code: special_issue_find(journal, type = "closed", years = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

title: Retrieves all special issues of a specified journal with URLs. Filters results by issue status (open, closed, or all) and optional year range. — special_issue_find
text: journal MDPI journal code type "closed", "open" "" special issues. "closed" default. years vector containing special issues closure dates limit search certain years verbose Logical. TRUE, informative messages printed function execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: Retrieves all special issues of a specified journal with URLs. Filters results by issue status (open, closed, or all) and optional year range. — special_issue_find
text: vector.

title: Retrieves all special issues of a specified journal with URLs. Filters results by issue status (open, closed, or all) and optional year range. — special_issue_find

title: MDPIexploreR 0.2.1
text: plot_article() now includes option “tat” plot turnaround times plot_article() type="tat" ignores Editorial Correction type articles TAT calculations plot_article() stops incorrect type plot requested article_info() now outputs Revised date column article_info() now outputs whether article open peer review plot_article() includes option summarize % available peer review year

title: MDPIexploreR 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-15 Preparations CRAN self_cite() now returns data frame displays error message references found. Verbosity options (hide messages progress bars) included article_info(), guest_editor_info() special_issue_find()

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.6
text: New function plot_articles() replaces functions average_graph(), summary_graph() type_graph() New function selfcite_check returns number articles referenced published authors vs total number references

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.5
text: Updated functions documentation Fixed clean_names() bug missing single name authors removing title. guest_editor_info() now allows limit targeted years guest_editor_info() now outputs number papers guest editor also role academic editor

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.4
text: Added internal function clean_names() homogenize editors authors names standard comparison reason. clean_names() incorporated guest_editor_info() name cleaning purposes, replacing previous code similar purpose guest_editor_info() Fixed bug ignoring guest editor without profile link guest_editor_info() Fixed code interpreting time last submission guest_editor_info() Fixed error generating duplicated guest editors column rt_sum_vector2 generated guest_editor_info() guest_editor_info() now outputs guest editor paper count special issue clean_names() longer replaces “dr” string inside namesspecial_issue_info() allows now target years interest via year=c(…)

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.3
text: guest_editor() longer part MDPIexploreR. Use special_issue_find() guest_editor_info() instead Cleared errors warnings R CMD check articles_info() replaced article_info(). article_info() transform editorial data lowercase facilitate use gsub()

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.2
text: Adding functions special_issue_find() & guest_editor_info() deprecate guest_editor() make workflow flexible.

title: MDPIexploreR 0.1.1
text: guest_editor() now selects two first words guest editors authors names comparison account discrepancies number surnames guest editors paper authors. (e.g. guest editor name = Dr. Perico Palotes Fernández, author name just Perico Palotes. ). guest_editor() d_over_deadline output column now considers latest article submission date special issue instead latest acceptance time. guest_editor() Assoc. Prof. guest editors now picked function guest_editor() Ignores papers type “Editorial”

title: MDPIexploreR 0.0.1
text: Repurposed R scripts first version ‘MDPIexploreR’ package
